entry.title: Roseburg Man Arrested After Puppy Killed in Recorded FaceTime Incident
entry.summary: Police have arrested a 21 year old Roseburg man accused of killing a four month old puppy during a FaceTime call. Investigators say blood was visible in the video, and the suspect’s girlfriend reported escalating abuse. He remains in custody on multiple felony animal abuse charges.

entry.title: Kotek appoints new judge to Douglas County Circuit Court
entry.summary: DOUGLAS COUNTY — On Tuesday, Gov. Tina Kotek announced that she will appoint Cadence L. Whiteley to the Douglas County Circuit Court.

entry.title: JosephJane Winery Announces Final Weekend as Owners Retire, Vineyard Estate Now for Sale
entry.summary: JosephJane Winery will close after its final sales weekend on December 13 and 14, offering major discounts as the owners retire. The Roseburg winery is also listing its vineyard estate for sale and hopes new owners will continue its long loved traditions.

entry.title: JosephJane Winery to close permanently
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — JosephJane Winery will close after this weekend.

entry.title: WISH UPON A STAR 12.9.25
entry.summary: Wish #2: Heidi’s parents died unexpectedly and it was a huge shock. Her dad asked his son Robin to send a WISH for Heidi’s teeth. Robin is making good on Dad’s wishes.

entry.title: Roseburg City Council Unanimously Approves $453K Radio Purchase Ahead of Countywide Digital Upgrade
entry.summary: The Roseburg City Council unanimously approved a $453,280 purchase of new digital radios for police, selecting the General Fund to cover the cost. The upgrade prepares officers for Douglas County’s new UHF system launching in February.

entry.title: Man Arrested After Investigation Into Suspected Fentanyl-Related Death in Green District
entry.summary: Detectives are investigating a suspected fentanyl overdose that left a Green District man dead. Evidence led officers to arrest 39-year-old George Perez, who is accused of selling fentanyl shortly before the death. More charges may follow as the case continues.

entry.title: Roseburg man dies in single-vehicle Douglas County crash near Glide
entry.summary: A 30-year-old Roseburg man died in a single-vehicle crash on Thursday evening near Glide, according to the Oregon State Police.

entry.title: Fatal Crash on Highway 138E Claims Life of Roseburg Man
entry.summary: A single-vehicle crash on Highway 138E late Thursday night claimed the life of 30-year-old Domonik Randsome Wright of Roseburg. His Chrysler 200 left the roadway, went airborne, rolled into a field, and caught fire. He was pronounced deceased at the scene.

entry.title: Death investigation leads to fentanyl arrest in Douglas County
entry.summary: A suspicious death in the Green District has led to the arrest of a Roseburg resident in connection with a possible fentanyl overdose, according to the Douglas County Sheriff's Office.

entry.title: MORNING CONVERSATION 12.8.25
entry.summary: From Rogue Credit Union and Brooke Communications, our first wish is granted. Sally talks about the impact on her kids’ following her husbands drowning 5 years ago. Now help is needed as she wrecked one vehicle and the second one needs repairs to reliable. Help is on the way from Wish Upon A Star.

entry.title: 33rd Annual Umpqua Valley Festival of Lights & Holiday Village
entry.summary: The 33rd Annual Umpqua Valley Festival of Lights at River Forks Park brings families together with thousands of displays, the Holiday Village, and the world’s largest nutcracker, all supporting Rotary’s 10,000 dollar annual student scholarship.

entry.title: Sheriff’s office seeking missing man
entry.summary: DOUGLAS COUNTY — The Douglas County Sheriff’s Office is seeking assistance from the public in locating a missing Lake County man after his vehicle was found in the Elliott State Forest.

entry.title: OPTIMIST CLUB WITH SANTA HOTLINE ON TUESDAY NIGHT
entry.summary: December 8, 2025 2:50 a.m. The Roseburg Optimist Club will have its Santa Hotline on Tuesday night. Kids can call and speak with Santa Claus from 6:00 p.m. to 8:00 p.m. The number to call is 440-4393. Parents should remember to only have kids call Santa on Tuesday and between those hours.
